channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Be a Part of RPI’s Premier Cybersecurity Team!
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM - The #1 collegiate cybersecurity CTF team in the country is looking for new players, so if you’d like to be part of the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory, just stop by Sage 3101 every Wednesday evening through the end of the semester! No experience necessary, just a willingness to learn and try new things. Contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Just In Time” Career Fair Prep with Western Digital to be Held September 25
item.description: It’s the week of the Career Fair, so if you need some last-minute prep, this is the workshop for you! Just attend this session in the CCPD conference room from 3:00PM to 4:00PM on Wednesday, September 25 to learn how to prepare your resume, deliver an elevator pitch, talk with employers, use the platform, and more!
item.author: Students

item.title: MANE to Host Sandia Information Session
item.description: Date: Friday, September 27, 2024 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - Attend this session to learn about Sandia National Labs, one of the largest Department of Energy (DOE) laboratories, as well as past work done in the MANE discipline! Sandia has received many awards and consistently ranks among the best large employers to work for nationally, and is one of the best for diversity.
item.author: Students

item.title: CCPD: RPI Alumni Session, Q&A with MathWorks to be Held September 25
item.description: From 6:30PM to 8:00PM on September 25 in DCC 337, RPI alum Noah Prisament will discuss his journey as an Intern and Engineer in MathWorks’ Engineering Development Group, and how he gained hands-on experience at the company; he will also answer questions. Please register on Handshake and submit MathWorks’ registration form.
item.author: Students

item.title: Book Your COMM+D Appointment Online!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re at the beginning brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design (Comm+D) can help! Just schedule an appointment with a member of our trained staff, then stop by the Comm+D offices on the lower level of Folsom Library.
item.author: Students

item.title: SWE to Host “Evening with Industry”
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 7:30 PM - 9:30 PM - If you’re an RPI student looking for an internship or job, join the Society of Women Engineers for this free “Evening with Industry” event to meet recruiters from companies who are looking to hire. Please note that the event will be capped at about 60 students.
item.author: Students

item.title: RPI Space, Science, and Technology Day to be Held September 30
item.description: Date: Monday, September 30, 2024 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM - As part of its Bicentennial celebration, Rensselaer will be hosting RPI Space, Science and Technology Day! During the event, multiple RPI astronautics and alums who have become international leaders in the world’s space effort will address the rapid development of commercial space science and technology, highlight current RPI research in space science and technology, and celebrate the Institute’s long history in the exploration of space.
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Seminars Continue September 25
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - During this seminar, speaker Dr. Ji-Young Kim will present “Leveraging Chiral Light-Matter Interaction for High Throughput Synthesis and Bioanalytical Chemistry.”
item.author: Community

item.title: Math Colloquium Slated for September 25
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 10:00 AM - 11:00 AM - This Mathematical Sciences Colloquium will feature a presentation titled “Direct interpolative construction of quantized tensor trains” by speaker Michael Lindsey from UC Berkeley.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Perspectives from Palestine” Event to be Held September 24
item.description: Date: Tuesday, September 24, 2024 6:00 PM - 9:00 PM - Hosted by Rensselaer Voices for Palestine, this event features Keren Carmeli, an Israeli-American and member of the Albany chapter of Jewish Voices for Peace, and Faris Amer, a Palestinian-American pharmaceutical professional at Regeneron and active member in the Capital Region’s Muslim community. Come for a chance to hear first-person perspectives from individuals who grew up in the region, as well as for a Q&A session.
item.author: Community

item.title: Campus Community Invited to ISC2 Cybersecurity Chapter Meetup
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - All are welcome to join the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory and DotCIO in the Rensselaer Union’s Shelnutt Gallery for their monthly ISC2 Capital District NY chapter meeting. This month, Dr. Callahan and Shoshana Sugerman will present their research with Generative AI. Please contact Dr. Brian Callahan if you have questions.
item.author: Community

item.title: Cognitive Science Seminar scheduled for September 25th
item.description: Please join the Cognitive Science Department in Carnegie 113 for a presentation by Dr. Ellie Pavlick, Assistant Professor of Computer Science and Linguistics at Brown University. Date: Wednesday, September 25th, 12:00pm to 1:30pm.
item.author: Community

item.title: Heffner Alumni House Parking Lot Closed Through Sunday
item.description: All members of the campus community should note that the parking lot behind the Heffner Alumni House will be closed all week through Sunday, September 29 for Reunion & Homecoming set-up and festivities. Drivers will need to find an alternate parking location.
item.author: Community

item.title: CBE Seminar Series Continues September 25
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 9:00 AM - 10:00 AM - CBE’s seminar series continues this week with guest speaker Dr. Doug Tree from BYU, who will give a talk titled “Multiscale Assembly of Polymer Materials away from Equilibrium.”
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Host Systems Engineering and Technology Management Review
item.description: Date: Wednesday, September 25, 2024 6:00 PM - 6:30 PM - Hosted by Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., this information session focuses on Rensselaer’s flexible, project-based, online Systems Engineering and Technology Management graduate degree that will help prepare decision-makers with broader and deeper capabilities in leading dynamic organizations. Please register if you plan to attend.
item.author: Community

item.title: Faculty/Staff In-Person Workshop to Offer Deeper Dive into Active Learning Approaches
item.description: Date: Monday, September 30, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Focusing on the three active learning concepts of the Jigsaw activity, Think/Pair/Share and working with Concepts Maps, this workshop will discuss the concept of each approach and give examples to help attendees think about how they might be able to incorporate the various approaches into their class as an activity. Please registerif you plan to attend!
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Finance Conference 2024 Scheduled for October 8
item.description:
Date: Tuesday, October 8, 2024 1:00 PM - 4:30 PM - Register to attend RPI’s first annual Finance Conference, a free event that offers a wonderful opportunity for networking and professional development! Topics will include financial reporting, proposal budget preparation, how to generate costs savings, and a demonstration of the new budget and forecasting tool.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
